trans-unit.source: Contains a list of selectable items.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>, which means it can contain a collection of objects of any type (such as string, image, or panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> class.

More than one item in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> is visible, unlike the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>, which has only the selected item visible unless the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsDropDownOpen%2A> property is `true`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectionMode%2A> property determines whether more than one item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> is selectable at a time.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectionMode%2A> property determines how many items a user can select at one time.

You can set the property to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Single> (the default), <xref:System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Multiple>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Extended>.
The following table described the behavior of these enumeration values.
Value
Description
The user can select only one item at a time.
The user can select multiple items without holding down a modifier key.
The user can select multiple consecutive items while holding down the SHIFT key or non-consecutive items by holding down the CTRL key and clicking the items.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> controls are often used with data binding.
For more information, see [Data Binding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md).
Displaying a large number of items may cause performance issues.
See [Optimizing Performance: Controls](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/optimizing-performance-controls.md) for more information.
Customizing the ListBox Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox>, see [ListBox Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/listbox-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the item that is initially selected when <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectionMode"></xref> is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Extended"></xref>.
The item that is initially selected when <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectionMode"></xref> is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Extended"></xref>.
Creates or identifies the element used to display a specified item.
The element used to display a specified item.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref> supports scrolling.

If the control has a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> in its style and has a custom keyboard scrolling behavior, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.HandlesScrolling%2A> should return `true`.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref> supports scrolling; otherwise, `false`.
Determines if the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own ItemContainer.
Specified item.
`true` if the item is its own `ItemContainer`; otherwise, `false`.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ListBoxAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] automation infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseCaptured"></xref> property changes.
Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs"></xref>.
Responds to the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs"></xref>.
Called when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref> reports a mouse move.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs"></xref>.
Responds to a list box selection change by raising a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectionChanged"></xref> event.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectionChangedEventArgs"></xref>.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
Preparing the element may involve applying styles, setting bindings, and so on.
Element used to display the specified item.
Specified item.
Causes the object to scroll into view.
If the object is not visible, it is aligned at the top or bottom of the viewport.
Object to scroll.
Selects all the items in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectionMode"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Single"></xref>.
Gets the currently selected items.
This property is meant to be used when <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectionMode%2A> does not equal <xref:System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Single>.
If the selection mode is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Single> the correct property to use is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem%2A>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
Returns a collection of the currently selected items.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectionMode"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Single"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectedItems"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the selection behavior for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMode.Single"></xref> selection.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.SelectionMode"></xref> dependency property.
Sets a collection of selected items.
Collection of items to be selected.
`true` if all items have been selected; otherwise, `false`.
Clears all the selection in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref>.
